link.label: Accessibility
link.text: Learn about the accessibility features that are available for the IBM products and the user assistance.

group.text: IBM products provide accessibility features to help you navigate the user interface and operate the controls with a keyboard and screen-reader software.

You can use keyboard shortcuts to navigate and perform tasks and use a screen reader, such as IBM Home Page Reader, to hear what is displayed on the screen. The online help provides detailed information about the keyboard shortcuts that are available for each part of the product.

You can navigate the different types of assistance by using the Tab and arrow keys, as well as shortcuts that are specific to the type of information that you are looking at. For example, when you are in the Samples or the Tutorials gallery, use the Tab or arrow keys to move through the items in the navigation pane, press Enter to open the item you want in the content pane, and press Ctrl+F6 to switch the focus to the content pane.

link.label: How to find information to assist you
link.text: Go to the help topics to read about the keyboard shortcuts that you can use to navigate through the product information.
